comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Caption is erroneously permuted, should be "E. Youngstown -- Vigilantes under Oscar Diser, City Solicitor" In 1914, Oscar R. Diser of Youngstown (Ohio) was a State Representative and republican candidate for Congress, see The Mahoning dispatch., August 07, 1914, Image 4, with photo. He didn't win the election. in 1916 he formed a committee of safety and helped stop the rioting in East Youngtown (according to The Mahoning dispatch., January 21, 1916, Image 4, column 4). The Mahoning dispatch., January 07, 1916, Image 6 reported that attorney Oscar E. Diser had been elected solicitor of East Youngstown by the council of that municipality. news.nnyln.net/tupper-lake/tupper-lake-herald-1914-1915/t..., column 1 "TROOPS QUIET MOB" says that about half a dozen men fell when Diser ordered to fire in the mob. The fire started by rioting strikers laid large parts of the town in ruins, see the Bisbee daily review., January 14, 1916, Image 1.
